get.description:
Internet Protocol Service Level Agreement (IPSLA) configuration.
This feature is not supported.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaIpsla_IpslaSchema.description:
Internet Protocol Service Level Agreement (IPSLA) configuration.
This feature is not supported.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

ipv4-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

ipv6-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

interface-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.

ipv4-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

ipv6-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

interface-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

ArubaIpsla_VoipConfig.description: Grouping for the Voice Over IP (VOIP) config.

x-enumDescriptions.G_711A: g711a codec type for the VoIP SLA test.
x-enumDescriptions.G_711U: g711u codec type for the VoIP SLA test.
x-enumDescriptions.G_729A: g729a codec type for the VoIP SLA test.

codec-type.x-typeDescription: Codec-type for the VoIP SLA test.
codec-type.description: Codec-type for the VOIP SLA test.

x-enumDescriptions.START_TIME: Start time for the IPSLA session.

start.description: Schedule type to start the session.

start-value.x-typeDescription:
A date and time, expressed in the format described in RFC3339.
That is to say:

YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ+-hh:mm

where YYYY is the year, MM is the month expressed as a two-digit
month (zero padding if required), DD is the day of the month,
expressed as a two digit value. T is the literal character 'T',
HH is the hour of the day expressed as a two digit number, using
the 24-hour clock, MM is the minute of the hour expressed as a
two digit number. Z is the literal character 'Z', followed by a
timezone offset expressed in hours (hh) and minutes (mm), both
expressed as two digit numbers. The time offset is specified as
a positive or negative offset to UTC using the '+' or '-'
character preceding the offset.

Optionally, fractional seconds can be expressed after the minute
of the hour as a decimal number of unspecified precision
reflecting fractions of a second.

x-enumDescriptions.FOREVER: Schedule to run the IP SLA forever.
x-enumDescriptions.REPEAT: Number of times the IP SLA tests to be repeated.
x-enumDescriptions.STOP_TIME: Stop time for the IPSLA session.

stop.description: Schedule type to stop the session.

repetitions.description:
The number of times the operation will be repeated.
This leaf is only valid when the end-condition is 'repetitions'.

stop-value.x-typeDescription:
A date and time, expressed in the format described in RFC3339.
That is to say:

YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ+-hh:mm

where YYYY is the year, MM is the month expressed as a two-digit
month (zero padding if required), DD is the day of the month,
expressed as a two digit value. T is the literal character 'T',
HH is the hour of the day expressed as a two digit number, using
the 24-hour clock, MM is the minute of the hour expressed as a
two digit number. Z is the literal character 'Z', followed by a
timezone offset expressed in hours (hh) and minutes (mm), both
expressed as two digit numbers. The time offset is specified as
a positive or negative offset to UTC using the '+' or '-'
character preceding the offset.

Optionally, fractional seconds can be expressed after the minute
of the hour as a decimal number of unspecified precision
reflecting fractions of a second.

ArubaIpsla_ThresholdConfig.description: Grouping for the IPSLA threshold config.

thresholds.description: List of threshold configurations per metric type.

x-enumDescriptions.DS_JITTER_POS: Monitor the destination to source positive jitter.
x-enumDescriptions.DST_TO_SRC_TIME: Monitor the destination to source time (one way).
x-enumDescriptions.ICPIF: Monitor the Calculated Planning Impairment Factor (ICPIF).
x-enumDescriptions.SD_JITTER_POS: Monitor the source to destination positive jitter.
x-enumDescriptions.SRC_TO_DST_TIME: Monitor the source to destination time (one way).

metric-type.x-typeDescription: SLA metric type to be monitored.
metric-type.description: SLA metric type to be monitored.

upper-limit.description: Acceptable upper-limit of threshold value for SLA.

lower-limit.description: Acceptable lower-limit of threshold value for SLA.

x-enumDescriptions.AGGREGATED: Trigger action when aggregated probes hit the threshold.
x-enumDescriptions.CONSECUTIVE: Trigger action after threshold is hit consecutively for n times.
x-enumDescriptions.IMMEDIATE: Trigger action immediately after threshold is hit.

type.x-typeDescription: Threshold type based on which action will be triggered.

count.description:
Maximum number of consecutive times the upper or lower threshold limit
may be violated before the threshold action is triggered.

x-enumDescriptions.LOG: Log an event when the threshold is hit.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Take no action when the threshold is hit.
x-enumDescriptions.TRAP: Send an SNMP trap when the threshold is hit.
x-enumDescriptions.TRAP_LOG: Send an SNMP trap and log an event when the threshold is hit.

action.x-typeDescription: Action to be triggered when configured threshold is hit.

ArubaIpsla_HttpConfig.description: Grouping for the HTTP/s IPSLA config.

x-enumDescriptions.GET: HTTP payload is generated by the system.
x-enumDescriptions.RAW: HTTP payload is generated by the user.

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) address to reach the HTTP/s server.

raw-payload.description: Raw payload in the HTTP/s request.

proxy-url.description: URL address of the proxy server.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.

x-enumDescriptions.DHCP: IPSLA session for Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP).
x-enumDescriptions.DNS: IPSLA session for DNS (Domain Name System).
x-enumDescriptions.HTTP: IPSLA session for Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP).
x-enumDescriptions.HTTPS: IPSLA session for Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS).
x-enumDescriptions.ICMP_ECHO: IPSLA session for Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo.
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_CONNECT: IPSLA session for Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) Connect.
x-enumDescriptions.UDP_ECHO: IPSLA session for User Datagram Protocol (UDP) Echo.
x-enumDescriptions.UDP_JITTER_VOIP: IPSLA session for UDP Jitter Voice over Internet Protocol (VOIP).

history-size.description: Size of the payload to add to ICMP echo and UDP echo probes.

payload-size.description: Size of the payload to add to ICMP echo and UDP echo probes.

tos.description: Type of Service (TOS) to add to ICMP echo and UDP echo probes.

frequency.description: Time gap between two consecutive probes of the SLA session.

destination-ipv4.x-typeDescription: Valid IPv4 address type for interface

destination-ipv6.x-typeDescription: Valid IPv6 address type for interface

destination-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.

domain-name-server-ipv4.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
domain-name-server-ipv4.description: IPv4 address of the DNS server.

domain-name-server-ipv6.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
domain-name-server-ipv6.description: IPv6 address of the DNS server.

num-of-packets.description: Number of packets to be sent out for a single probe for UDP Jitter SLA type.

packet-interval.description:
Inter packet interval in milliseconds, which is to be used for packets
that are sent out for a single probe for UDP Jitter SLA type

responder-ipv4-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

responder-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
responder-port.description: TCP/UDP port number on which the responder needs to listen to.

responder-vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
responder-vrf.description: VRF name in SLA will send or receive packets

x-enumDescriptions.RESP_UDP_JITTER_VOIP: IPSLA responder for UDP Jitter VOIP.

x-enumDescriptions.SLA_DESTINATION_MANUAL: Perform IPSLA on manually configured destination
x-enumDescriptions.SLA_DESTINATION_TUNNEL: Perform IPSLA on IPSec tunnel destination

x-enumDescriptions.DHCP: IPSLA session for Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP).
x-enumDescriptions.DNS: IPSLA session for DNS (Domain Name System).
x-enumDescriptions.HTTP: IPSLA session for Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP).
x-enumDescriptions.HTTPS: IPSLA session for Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS).
x-enumDescriptions.ICMP_ECHO: IPSLA session for Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo.
x-enumDescriptions.TCP_CONNECT: IPSLA session for Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) Connect.
x-enumDescriptions.UDP_ECHO: IPSLA session for User Datagram Protocol (UDP) Echo.
x-enumDescriptions.UDP_JITTER_VOIP: IPSLA session for UDP Jitter Voice over Internet Protocol (VOIP).

x-enumDescriptions.SLA_DEST_STATIC_IP: Use static IP for SLA probing
x-enumDescriptions.SLA_DEST_FQDN: Use Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) for SLA probing

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

x-enumDescriptions.SLA_BEHAVIOR_LIVENESS: SLA compliance depends on liveness of probe destination
x-enumDescriptions.SLA_BEHAVIOR_PERFORMANCE: SLA compliance depends on the configured performance metrics

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.
